function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Failure to adequately assess the impact of supply chain disruption on performance may result in unpreparedness for contagious disease outbreaks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of supply chain structure and organization may create vulnerabilities to contagious disease propagation within the network.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Analysis of journals and country of affiliation may reveal trends in research focus and funding, but may also indicate potential hotspots for contagion.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High concentration of publications in specific journals may indicate a narrow focus on certain aspects of the contagion, potentially limiting the understanding of broader risk factors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"International collaboration in research may facilitate knowledge exchange, but it also carries the risk of introducing and spreading contagious diseases across borders.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mention of covid-19 and its impact on supply chain management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Study of disease spread modeling and its relevance to the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Analysis of the economic impact of the pandemic on supply chains and smes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accelerated review process due to covid-19 outbreak","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased publication lag during covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of vosviewer software to analyze co-occurrence of keywords","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bibliometric analysis to understand the publications related to contagious diseases may overlook important insights and trends.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider the impact of global events such as covid-19 on the research landscape may result in outdated or incomplete insights.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bias in the selection of data sources for the bibliometric analysis may skew the interpretation of research trends and priorities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exponential growth of published works between 2017 and 2020","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inclusion of papers not relevant to covid-19 challenges","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reading and analyzing a large set of manuscripts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of logical connectors in search may result in missing relevant papers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential bias in search results due to discipline limitations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete capture of relevant publications due to time limitations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential bias in the literature review process due to authors’ idiosyncratic decisions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistency in the search process when collecting and identifying research papers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitation of search to peer-reviewed journals may exclude relevant literature and research output from other sources","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fragility of global supply network exposed by covid-19 outbreaks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of supply chain resilience and reach in operations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in consumer behavior leading to increased purchasing of certain products","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Economic and social costs associated with isolation strategies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for specific goods and services during the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The recent outbreak of covid-19 has endangered the health of the world’s population and has hampered the global economy.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disruptions and closure of different sectors, including farms, production plants, logistics facilities, and transportation, is unprecedented worldwide.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mandatory collective isolation i.e. ’social distancing’ has impacted consumer behavior and economic sectors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High levels of uncertainty and instability in global supply chains","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper models for sustainable and effective distribution strategies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity of the supply chain due to globalisation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public places may become hotspots for disease transmission if ventilation rates are not maximized","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate scheduling and population distribution patterns in buildings may lead to increased infection risk","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extended working hours and prolonged occupant presence in buildings can increase infection risk","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uniform population distribution pattern can reduce the number of infected people by up to 56%","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Optimal population distribution pattern in terms of energy consumption can reduce energy consumption by up to 32%","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing ventilation rate in buildings reduces the number of infected people but increases hvac energy consumption","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reducing class duration may result in a reduction of 49.6% in the number of infected people with covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reducing class duration results in a 28% and 28.6% reduction in energy consumption in winter and summer, respectively.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The study identifies the impact of occupants, air exchange rate, class duration, and working hours on energy consumption and covid-19 infection risk.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased population density due to longer working hours may lead to higher risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extension of class duration may result in prolonged exposure time and higher risk of virus transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extended exposure time in spaces with infected people increases the risk of infection, despite virus particles deactivating over time.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extending working hours of university buildings increases hvac energy consumption and occupant presence, impacting covid-19 transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased air exchange rate may lead to higher energy consumption in the building.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher air exchange rate may lead to decreased risk of virus transmission and infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of occupant distribution on covid-19 transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
